1 #! /usr/bin/env python
2 import roslib, rospy, csv, itertools, sys
3 from processhandle import ProcessHandler
4 from remote_launch_server.srv import *
5 from remote_launch_server.msg import *
6 
7 
8 class RemoteLaunchServer:
9  def __init__(self):
10 
11  # Init node
12  self.node_name = 'remote_launch_server'
13  rospy.init_node(self.node_name)
14 
15  # Set node rate to 1Hz
16  rate = rospy.Rate(1)
17 
18  # Get config file parameter
19  filename = rospy.get_param("/"+self.node_name+"/cfg_file", "../config/launch_cfg.csv")
20 
21  # Read config file
22  self.read_cfg(filename)
23 
24  # Initiate services servers
25  self.start_launch_file_server()
26  self.stop_launch_file_server()
27 
28  # Initiate publishers
29  self.publisher_list_launch_files = self.list_launch_files_publisher()
30  try:
31  self.publisher_list_launch_files
32  except:
33  rospy.loginfo("Deleting node %s", self.node_name)
34  sys.exit()
35 
36  # Handle callbacks and publish messages
37  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
38 
39  # Call publisher for list_launch_files topic
40  self.publish_list_launch_files(self.publisher_list_launch_files, self.launch_list)
41 
42  # Sleep based on time this loop took
43  rate.sleep()
44 
45  # Reads filename as a CSV file where a line for each launch file configuration
46  # Parameters are comma separated in the order (name, command, working_directory)
47  def read_cfg(self, filename):
48 
49  rospy.logdebug("Will try to read file %s",filename)
50 
51  # List of LaunchFile objects
52  self.launch_list = []
53 
54  # Open file, raises IOError exception on failure
55  try:
56  csvfile = open(filename, 'rb')
57  except IOError as err:
58  rospy.logerr("Failed opening file %s: %s", filename, err.strerror)
59  return
60 
61  # Read file with csv module
62  reader = csv.reader(csvfile, delimiter=',', quoting=csv.QUOTE_ALL) # comma separated values
63  try:
64  for row in reader:
65  # Append a LaunchFile object with the parameters in row to launch_list
66  self.launch_list.append(LaunchFile(row))
67  except csv.Error as err:
68  rospy.logerr("Failed reading file %s, line %d: %s", filename, reader.line_num, err)
69  return
70 
71  rospy.loginfo("Successfully read %d launch files from file %s", len(self.launch_list), filename)
72 
73 
74  # Prints the launch_list list, mainly used for debugging
75  def print_cfg(self):
76  for lf in self.launch_list:
77  rospy.loginfo("%d. Name: %s Command: %s Directory: %s", lf.id, lf.name, lf.cmd, lf.wd)
78 
79  # StartLaunchFile service server
80  def start_launch_file_server(self):
81 
82  try:
83  # Doesn't need a huge buffer
84  self.server_start_launch_file = rospy.Service(self.node_name+'/StartLaunchFile', StartLaunchFile, self.handle_start_launch_file, 20)
85  except rospy.ServiceException, e:
86  rospy.logerr("Service StartLaunchFile creation failed: %s", e)
87  return
88 
89  rospy.loginfo("Service StartLaunchFile has started")
90 
91  # StartLaunchFile service handler
92  def handle_start_launch_file(self, req):
93  rospy.logdebug("Received request to start file with id %d", req.rlf.id)
94 
95  # Command arguments (optional)
96  args = req.args
97 
98  # Prevent dangerous arguments characters
99  if ('&' in args) or (';' in args):
100  args = ''
101 
102  reqid = req.rlf.id
103  # Check if LaunchFile id exists
104  if reqid > len(self.launch_list):
105  rospy.logwarn("Id %d requested was not found", reqid)
106  return StartLaunchFileResponse(success=False)
107 
108  # Get information from the LaunchFile object
109  thisLF = self.launch_list[reqid]
110 
111  # Check if the process is already running
112  try:
113  thisLF.process
114  rospy.logwarn("Id %d already has a running process", reqid)
115  return StartLaunchFileResponse(success=False)
116  except:
117  pass
118 
119  # Attach a ProcessHandler object to with the command + args
120  thisLF.process = ProcessHandler(thisLF.cmd + ' ' + args, thisLF.wd)
121 
122  rospy.loginfo("Successfully started file with id %d", reqid)
123  # Service response
124  return StartLaunchFileResponse(success=True)
125 
126  # StopLaunchFile service server
127  def stop_launch_file_server(self):
128 
129  try:
130  # Doesn't need a huge buffer
131  self.server_stop_launch_file = rospy.Service(self.node_name+'/StopLaunchFile', StopLaunchFile, self.handle_stop_launch_file, 20)
132  except rospy.ServiceException, e:
133  rospy.logerr("Service StopLaunchFile creation failed: %s", e)
134  return
135 
136  rospy.loginfo("Service StopLaunchFile has started")
137 
138  # StopLaunchFile service handler
139  def handle_stop_launch_file(self, req):
140  reqid = req.rlf.id
141  rospy.logdebug("Received request to stop file with id %d", reqid)
142 
143  # Check if LaunchFile id exists
144  if reqid > len(self.launch_list):
145  rospy.logwarn("Id %d requested was not found", reqid)
146  return StopLaunchFileResponse(success=False)
147 
148  # Get information from the LaunchFile object
149  thisLF = self.launch_list[reqid]
150 
151  # Check if there is a running process
152  try:
153  thisLF.process
154  except:
155  rospy.logwarn("Id %d requested does not have a running process", reqid)
156  return StopLaunchFileResponse(success=False)
157  else:
158  # Deleting the object terminates safely, might take some time
159  del thisLF.process
160 
161  rospy.loginfo("Successfully stopped file with id %d", reqid)
162  # Service response
163  return StopLaunchFileResponse(success=True)
164 
165  # Create the list_launch_files topic publisher
166  def list_launch_files_publisher(self):
167  try:
168  # Publishes an array of std_msgs/UInt8 values
169  pub = rospy.Publisher(self.node_name+'/list_launch_files', RemoteLaunchFileArray, queue_size=2)
170  except rospy.ROSException, e:
171  rospy.logerr("Publisher list_launch_files creation failed: %s", e)
172  return
173  else:
174  return pub
175 
176  # Publish RemoteLaunchFileArray messages in list_launch_files topic
177  def publish_list_launch_files(self, publisher, launch_list):
178 
179  # Array of RemoteLaunchFile messages
180  '''
181  RemoteLaunchFile.msg
182  -uint8 id
183  -string name
184  -string command
185  -string working_directory
186  -bool running
187  '''
188 
189  # Initiate the message
190  msg = RemoteLaunchFileArray()
191 
192  # Go through all the available launch files
193  for lf in launch_list:
194 
195  # Create object with all parameters except 'running'
196  rlf = RemoteLaunchFile(id=lf.id, name=lf.name, command=lf.cmd, working_directory=lf.wd)
197 
198  # Find out if process is running
199  try:
200  # Touch process object, will raise exception if does not exist
201  lf.process
202  except:
203  rlf.running = False
204  else:
205  rlf.running = lf.process.is_active()
206  if not rlf.running:
207  # Kill process, something went wrong
208  del lf.process
209 
210  # Append this object to array
211  msg.rlf_array.append(rlf)
212 
213  # Publish the message
214  publisher.publish(msg)
215 
216 
217 
218 
219 class LaunchFile:
220  # Persistent _ID in class scope
221  _ID = itertools.count(0)
222 
223  # Class constructor, expects parameters as a list of strings in the order (name, command, working_directory)
224  def __init__(self, parameters):
225  # Store _ID in this instance and increment for the next instance of class
226  self.id = self._ID.next()
227  # Name as a description of the command
228  self.name = parameters[0]
229  # Command to run
230  self.cmd = parameters[1]
231  # Working directory
232  self.wd = parameters[2]
233 
234 
235 #Main function
236 if __name__ == '__main__':
237  try:
238  rl = RemoteLaunchServer()
239  except rospy.ROSInterruptException:
240  pass
